releases.details: Part of 'Daleks: The Early Years' release

notes: This story had the working titles of 'The Daleks (Part IV)' and 'Battle Of Wits'.
Only the second, fifth and tenth episodes of this twelve-part story exist in the BBC Archives.
The Christmas Day 1965 episode 'The Feast of Steven' was never telerecorded and is lost.
There were no plans to make Katarina a main companion, as it was felt that a character from the past who needed everything explained to her would be a burden.
There were plans to make Sara a companion, but Jean Marsh didn't want to commit to a series.
The Daleks' Master Plan and Mission to the Unknown were the only 1960s Doctor Who stories offered for overseas sale but never purchased.

in_universe_mythology: References to the Embodiment of Gris
individuals: Mavic Chen - Guardian of the Solar System
Trantis - Ruler of the Fifth Galaxy
Zephon - Master of the Fifth Galaxy
items: Taranium - a rare mineral found on Uranus
The Time Destructor - the Daleks' ultimate weapon

continuity_notes: The Space Security Service agent Marc Cory initially discovered the Daleks' plans on Kembel.
The Monk was able to bypass the dimensional control that the Doctor sabotaged in a previous story.
The Doctor was artificially aged on two later occasions, though the ageing was subsequently reversed.
Sara first encountered the Daleks on M5 many years earlier.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor's TARDIS arrives on the planet Kembel in the year 4000, where the Daleks are conspiring to conquer the Solar System. Their scheme involves treachery at the highest levels and a weapon capable of destroying the very fabric of time. The Doctor and his friends must prevent this catastrophe, but there is no guarantee they will escape with their lives.

The Doctor, Steven, and Katarina become entangled in the Daleks' plan after landing on Kembel. They must work to stop the Daleks from obtaining the rare mineral taranium, which is needed to power their ultimate weapon - the Time Destructor. The Doctor tries to infiltrate the Dalek meeting on Kembel, while his companions attempt to steal the Daleks' spaceship. This leads to the death of both Katarina and Sara Kingdom.

The Doctor and his remaining companions - Steven and Sara - continue to try to thwart the Daleks' plans. They hijack the Daleks' time machine and travel to various locations, including Ancient Egypt, to try to stop the Daleks. The Monk also becomes involved, seeking revenge on the Doctor. Ultimately, the Doctor activates the Time Destructor in a final attempt to defeat the Daleks, but this leads to the deaths of Sara and the devastating transformation of Kembel.
